text: Hey team! Glad the event is coming together nicely

A few requests on the landing page you built:
1) Can we adjust the name to not include the word “day”? I want to avoid any external or internal confusion around this being HubSpot official or not. With Agency Partner Day and Platform Partner Day, I think those that don’t read the fine print might assume it’s being hosted officially by us-- and I want to avoid that. Suggestions: HubSpot Developer Community Meetup, HubSpot Developers: Community Meetup, HubSpot Developer Meetup Group.
2) Can we adjust the “hosted by HubSpot” language to read “sponsored by HubSpot”? Like #1, I feel like “hosted” has more of an “ownership” status.
3) As cool as the little sprocket guy with eyeballs looks, it’s against our brand guidelines (and I think he’s HubSpot orange circa 2014 :stuck_out_tongue: ). You can reference this to see what we can do: <https://www.HubSpot.com/style-guide>. Bunch of helpful resources there.

Not a problem we can get all of these changes made.

In reference to #1 - unfortunately we’re still deciding an official name that one was just placeholder. We’ll make sure to avoid using the word Day.
#2 - understood, AJ I’d maybe just remove the parenthesis text from the header . We already have the location in there. I considered putting sponsored by HubSpot there, but then thought - we plan to have other sponsors on that page, so that could look odd.
<@U2H3TT8F2>

BTW AJ great photo of you giving a speech, no joke, it’s perfect.
That's not me lol, it's just a stock photo. Also, I plan to replace sprocky once we have a more official lineup. Also will make the change on the text as soon noted above.
lol for real that’s not you!?  nice lol He has a similar trim to his beard and the hair aside from the way it’s parted looks kinda similar from the back too!
Lol I never noticed that. But yea I don't wear plaid. I leave that up to <@U38EZFVFE> ;)
Im Booked, Ready for the rumble!
